the collapse of such a dictatorship was "inevitable" in Egypt, as well as in other countries throughout the world. "What comes next, it's hard to predict," Patrick Leahy said. A huge part of( Egypt's) natural product is tourism. They've got to get tourists feeling free to go back. Nobody's about to book a trip to Egypt right now. Bernie Sanders , I-Vt., had a similar response and called on the United States to support a transition to democracy.

Meanwhile, Sergio Marchionne also said Fiat will not consider selling its Alfa Romeo brand to Volkswagen AG. VW Chairman Ferdinand Piech has indicated an interest in buying Alfa from Fiat Group. But Sergio Marchionne said: As long as I am CEO of Chrysler and Fiat, Mr. Ferdinand Piech will never have Alfa Romeo. It's hands-off. I told him. I will call him and I will e-mail him.
